reviews_data.review_text: They forgot to put multiple cards in my order that i had already paid for. This is the 2nd time this has happened! When i tried calling them to remedy the situation they hung up on me. Will not be returning.
Staff is always friendly. Place is always clean. The woman who was at the snack station was a joy to purchase from. I love this place

First time in the store.

Tyler was super helpful and staff very friendly.

Huge area in the back with lots of tables for TTRPGs,  MtG, etc

Reasonable pricing as well on all things gaming. They also have art and minis from local artists. Major props to them for supporting local,  HUZZAH!!!!!

IMO best game shop within 20min of Charlotte. They support online order of magic singles from their website and they usually have a healthy stock of MTG product in general. Board game and Warhammer selection is awe inspiring. Staff is great and knowledgeable. They also stock a lot of Gunpla. You could find at least one gift for all of your nerdy friends and family.
Still great, nice and helpful employees all around good experience
Amazing place! Im new to collect cards and selling them and they made the process easy with the online buy list on their website!!
Nice clean shop, not like the ones I'm used to. Staff is friendly and they host fun events
Thank you for creating a safe environment for our children to play!

I've been going to this store for years playing 40k but recently getting back into MtG seeing their prices being so absurdly high and trying to trade in some of my old collection only getting 40% value in cash and automatic grading as LP just doesnt make me want to buy mtg products from them anymore. The play space in the back and their selection of other games is very nice and I do still purchase their warhammer products from time to time.

Great place to pick up single cards, packs, and starter decks for multiple tcg series. Also has a huge selection of board games, puzzles, and gunpla. The play space can get a little crowded and loud during popular times but they have a nice variety of snacks and beverages available.
Best comic and gaming shop in / near Charlotte.
Good staff and a good vibe.
Hunter & Misty were awesome help! Shop is huge and has an amazing selection and play space.  Thank you for the friendly service, can't wait to make this our FLGS
I love getting mtg cards from here and playing a few pick up games with new friends to be
Great staff great selection

The Mighty Meeple is a fantastic game store! It’s well-kept and has a great atmosphere, with lots of people clearly enjoying themselves. The snack bar is a great feature. Perfect for longer gaming sessions! I also appreciated how neatly organized the Warhammer terrain items were. Great place to shop, play, and hang out!
Solid shop with knowledgeable and friendly staff
Great place. Amazing selection. Great people. ignore the 1 star andys who think they own the world. I've been to 3 of their WH40k tourneys and the atmosphere is amazing.
store looks cool online, but i called and staff member was kinda rude and dismissive,

I adore this shop! The staff isn't just professional, but super nice and extremely helpful! Place is clean and fully stocked. Plenty of seats to play any games. Just awesome! Customer for life!! I wanted to update my review and mention by name Misty, Hunter, and Tyler for all their help on Monday 6/2/25!! Thank you Misty for calling me to let me know I left a card behind!!
The staff at Mighty Meeple are super friendly! Misty, Hunter, and Tyler were/are amazing! This establishment has the best selection of magic cards, board games, and more! Thank you for all you do!!
Love supporting my Local Game Stores! Might Meeple staff are very nice, welcoming, helpful, and host fun game nights! Staff are very good about monitoring and helping by turns.
First time brining my son to grab some Pokémon cards. They didn’t have what he was looking for but the staff was so nice!!
Amazing stock and great prices however the online support hasn’t been the best , maybe I’m not using the right platform(Facebook messenger) but the service I’ve recieved could be better
INCREDIBLE

The Mighty Meeple is a wonderful hobby shop focusing on tabletop gaming. They focus on Pokémon, Magic: The Gathering, and collectible trading card games. Also, they have products and a dedicated game space for Warhammer 40K. There is a large place space in the back where events are held multiple evenings during the week and weekend.
One of the best LGS!

Excellent major spot in the Charlotte area for tabletop games, miniature wargaming and supplies, role playing games and collectable card games. Biggest selection around almost to the point of you name it they got it, or at least if it's something they don't have they can probably get it for you. I mostly partake in the mini wargaming and I love that they carry so many ranges of paints from the staples like The Army Painter fanatic line, Vallejo, Two Thin Coats, and they just got the whole Pro Acryl range. They've also got hands down the biggest selection of minis from Dungeons and Dragons, Warhammer, Star wars... this list can go on for a while. All of these hobbies means they of course have a big table area in the back and there are always people there playing cards, or any other games each evening. Can't recommend this place enough, GO THERE, have fun.

I was in this store yesterday on 5/6 in the afternoon. Traveling for work I paint in my hotel often, had a few items I needed to grab. Stopped in and received excellent customer service from the gentlemen working. I forgot some of my black foam I use for weathering and asked the clerk if he had any. He without hesitation checked behind the counter and threw me a chunk free of charge! Whenever I find myself In Chatllote I will be back!!
Easily the based board game store I've ever been too. Multiple events each day, excellent prices, friendly staff, and a bar!

If I could put half a star I would, they have a terrible and I mean TERRIBLE buying and selling system, the only thing they have going for them is the fact that they have an organized website. They automatically take your cards as LP and give you 50% trade value and even less cash.

Been coming here for a while. It's a great local place with super friendly and knowledgeable staff. They run great events. I'm in love with their two-headed giant prerelease. Their King of the Hill Commarder Sealed League is a lot of fun too. I could ramble on but just know it's a great place.
Great store with plenty of space for product and a wonderful event space.  Everyone we have encountered there has been friendly, helpful and welcoming.  Will return for sure.

Mighty Meeple is an absolute treasure! My son and I play Magic: The Gathering here at least once a week, and over time, it has become so much more than just a game store—they truly feel like part of our extended family. The team is always kind, helpful, and genuinely fun to be around. The store is clean, well-stocked, and offers a great selection of games, cards, and accessories.

As a woman who enjoys gaming, I also really appreciate how welcoming and comfortable the environment is. It can be intimidating to step into a space where there aren’t many women players, but I’ve always felt completely at ease here. The community is respectful and inclusive, and that makes a huge difference.

Whether you’re a new player or a longtime fan, Mighty Meeple makes everyone feel at home. We’re so grateful to have a place like this in our community. Shout out to the regular commander night crew - Sean, Alex x 2, Thomas, and Preston! We appreciate your guys for all that you do.

This is a wonderful, well-run, independently-owned local gaming and art supply store with a vibrant and inclusive atmosphere. They also have a small convenience store and beer tap inside (open most days, maybe not Monday?). It can get very busy, so be careful where you park and pay attention to the signage from the neighboring businesses. If you're unsure, just touch base with the helpful staff! Flag them down if you need to, they also have an online presence and that is usually hopping, so they are rarely just hanging out, though I have always been greeted and even remembered each time I go in. I'm totally an introvert and I prefer not to be talked to so I notice when people do... because I try to melt into the floor 😉 You can also place an order online to pick up in the store and that is probably the approach that most people use. We usually go here to get painting supplies for miniatures or for trading cards. The prices are tied to online markets and demand in a pretty transparent and fair way, but the cards are also graded conservatively compared to online sellers so the prices are competitive, especially considering it's a brick and mortar that provides services and community (and multiple local jobs) that online retailers do not. They host multiple sanctioned and promotional events and provide a large gaming space that welcomes people to just hang out and play, build, or paint in the back. If the table is reserved for an event it will probably say so. I was nervous at first because I didn't know the rules but the main courtesy/rule I've noticed is probably no food or drink near other people's stuff or in the front of the store, though they are allowed. Other specific play rules and things are clearly posted. It's worth checking out the location and events if you can, including some very worthwhile community fundraisers. There are also ladies nights and events geared towards younger kids, and you can find those on their Facebook page. 💖💕

Amazing place to buy and play at. It doesn't matter your game they have it or a group of people playing it. I love the Warhammer tournaments and meeting up with a friend on a Friday night for a brew and quick game of AoS.
Knowledgeable and super friendly staff. Great place to get the cards and supplies I need and then tons of room in the play area to have a few games and hang out with my friends or make new ones.

If you’re a fan of tabletop gaming, Magic: The Gathering, or Warhammer, then Mighty Meeple is the place to be! This incredible game store offers a welcoming atmosphere where enthusiasts can buy, sell, and dive into their favorite games with fellow players.
The store boasts a wide selection of tabletop games, miniatures, and trading card essentials, making it easy to find exactly what you need—whether it’s a rare Magic: The Gathering card or the latest Warhammer model. The staff is knowledgeable and always eager to help, offering insights and recommendations that make shopping a breeze.
Best games store I've been to in my 25 years of life. Everyone is super nice and willing to help out, no matter if you've been playing the game for 10 years or just getting into the hobby

This store has a fantastic atmosphere, great and welcoming community and helpful staff. Been going to pre release events and FnM for years now and enjoy it every time. The back room is spacious with plenty of tables for tcg, tabletop and a warhammer section. Would highly recommend for experienced and new players alike.

I've been trying out a lot of board games stores in the Charlotte area and this one is my favorite. They have a huge inventory, restock frequently, and have a board game library you can try completely for free!
Good Free Pokemon tournamnets weekly w/ prize packs

Honestly, this is my personal favorite store I've been to in NC.

I think my favorite thing about them, is that it genuinely feels like they just support everything tabletop related. It's a big store with a ton of variety, and if you can think of something you wanna get into there's decent odds they have a community for it at the store.

Miniature games, TTRPG's, Board Game Nights, and a Night for most of the bigger TCG's out there. Altered, Pokemon, Magic, One Piece, Lorcana, Digimon, Universus, even Union Arena I believe. They foster incredible communities, and that's what I love about supporting them. The staff is also incredibly friendly, and easy to talk to. I really can't say I've ever had a single bad experience here.

It's a 40 minute drive for me, and I still usually make the drive over places I can go closer just because I like the place that much more than other stores I could be going to in order to  play games!
Everyone is very welcoming to newcomers- highly recommend ladies night for magic. For a very male dominated game, I was intimidated but really enjoy the environment and women I have played with.

i love going into mighty meeple! they have been my go-to card shop since i started collecting and playing MTG, 2 years ago. everyone is always so helpful and ready to crack a joke or two. it’s a refreshing place to go for a beginner who has a lot of questions :)
One of the true gems in the trading card scene in Charlotte, give them a visit!
Great store for all board game needs. If you can pay them a visit to help!

Mighty Meeple has been my go-to local game store for years, and it continues to stand out as one of the best in the area. Whether you’re a long-time player or just getting into tabletop games, this store offers a welcoming and engaging experience that’s hard to beat. I primarily participate in their Magic: The Gathering Modern events, and the player base around this format is excellent. The community strikes a rare balance—players are highly competitive but also approachable and encouraging. It’s not uncommon to see newer players receiving helpful advice from seasoned veterans, creating a healthy and positive environment for growth. The staff at Mighty Meeple have never been anything but kind, respectful, and helpful. They foster a space where everyone feels welcome, provided they treat others with the same respect. The tone set by the team makes a noticeable difference—whether you’re trading cards, joining a tournament, or just browsing, you feel valued. Mighty Meeple runs a packed weekly calendar filled with events for various trading card games. The owners, Dave and Tom, bring unique strengths to the store. Dave is the friendly, welcoming face who greets you at the door and makes everyone feel at home. Tom handles the business operations and, while more reserved initially, proves to be warm and genuinely passionate about the store and its players once you get to know him. The selection of Magic singles, sealed products, board games, and accessories is among the best I’ve seen at a local game store. They stock both popular and hard-to-find items, and the inventory is clearly curated with serious gamers in mind. Their trade-in policy is tough but fair—they accept cards in Light Play condition and offer bonus credit if you opt for store credit over cash, which is a great option for regular customers. The play area is one of the largest in the region, comfortably accommodating large events and casual groups alike. The tables are clean, well-maintained, and always buzzing with activity in the evenings. They also offer a library of board games available for in-store play, making it easy to try new games before committing to a purchase. The store is frequently packed during peak hours, which speaks volumes about the community that’s been built here. Mighty Meeple isn’t just a local game store—it’s a cornerstone of the gaming community. With an incredible staff, thoughtful ownership, and a vibrant player base, it's a model for what a game store should be. Whether you're looking to compete, learn, or simply connect with other players, this is the place to be.

Amazing local game store. Inclusive, fun, and accommodating. Great range of products in the shop in front, and a great community of gamers in the room in back. The mullet of LGSes, you might say. A fantastic place to buy supplies, play TCGs or TTRPGs, or shop for gifts for gamers you love.

Been going here for years now. Lots of different events are hosted, wide selection of games to choose from, employees are helpful, owner is nice, decent prices. My go to LGS in the Charlotte/Concord area

This place rules!

They have a massive stock of board games, cards, all kinds of incredible things for playing games. And their back room is huge and has tons of rooms to play games with old friends or, like I have done recently, make NEW friends! This place is seriously so awesome.

As great as all of that is, the real special part about this store is their staff. Everyone, and I mean every last person there, is just so nice. They make you feel welcome when you're new to any particular interest or hobby. They are happy to talk and share their knowledge with you when you're just getting started and many of them will even come and play games WITH you on their days off. They have treated my young kids with so much kindness and love, and we all feel so welcomed here.

You know this is a special place when you see so many of the staff hanging out there before work, after, and on their days off.

I cannot recommend this store enough, you definitely need to check it out and support them.
Excellent selection of board games and the staff is always happy to help with recommendations.
Very friendly and knowledgeable, they host all kinds of games and the best part is they have beer!

Great store with a nice selection of boardgames and tcg singles. The staff are super friendly and the community is always willing to help out new players. There's always some kind of event going on in the play space, but depending on the event, parking can get pretty limited.

This store is a true gem. Amazing selection of TCG apparel like sleeves and deck boxes, great board games selection (including free ones in the place space!), and an amazing suite of events, especially for MTG. I love selling cards here for their generous store credit policy just so I can go to more events at this wonderful game store.

Mighty Meeple is hands down the cleanest, most welcoming, best smelling game shop in the greater Charlotte area. If you’re looking for fair prices, a dope spot to play games or if you want to meet friendly people, look no further than Mighty Meeple! 10/10 recommend!
Mighty Meeple has all your games needs! If not, they are helpful in finding and getting what you need!
Went here with my boyfriend last month to browse while we were in town visiting. The regulars and the staff were super friendly and chill! Ended up getting a Magic card at a really good price!
This store has been a staple for me since I moved down to Charlotte.
Amazing place to get together with friends and place some games. Staff is amazing and always willing to help. Can’t recommend this place enough

The Mighty Meeple truly checks every box. Large play space area with a more than healthy inventory ranging from TCG Singles and Sealed product to Tabletop Games and Accessories.

Plenty of food options nearby and it’s located minutes from Concord Mills.

Tom and Dave have truly built an amazing store and community at The Mighty Meeple.

Hands down some of the most down to earth and knowledgeable people. Whenever I’m needing help building a deck, I’m always getting full guidance and respect. I love these guys and spend most of my money here!!!!

Clean, bright, spacious, plenty of amenities, and friendly staff. Home to many different games and fosters a great community. Lots of snacks and drinks available making it an even better place for long gaming sessions.
Nice Game shop, had a nice selection of its. Good for warhammer and cards like magic and pokémon.
Always a pleasure to shop at the MM.  The gaming area seems to get better every time I visit and the staff is always great.
Great card selection and play room, easy buying and selling, fantastic dudes behind the counter
Great place with excellent customer service and clean, large play area. Misty is great. Would recommend.

The people there were nice and helpful. I just wished I could have looked through more cards myself instead of having to look them up online then check out to see them. Bit still good. Lots of magic cards
Amazing staff. Has a big selection for all types of board games and card games. They host multiple events during the week. Very welcoming.

Store looked nice but the lady at the counter was rude. I was looking to sell some cards, which I knew they’d only offer a % of market value and was fine with. I got told I need to go review their buy list and create this online. I wouldn’t have minded to do this but I was already in the store and would’ve rather complete the transaction in store to avoid an additional trip. I created the buy list and saw what they’d offer and then sold them the next day for more to another collector. Moral of the story, capitalize on the foot traffic in your store and don’t be rude! Won’t be back.
This place is the AWESOMES!! Great for Commander game play!!
Great game store.  Great selection of games, room to spread out and play.  A full calander of things to do.

First of all I just want to give a shout out to Jon! I appreciate seeing him every single Friday when I go to play MTG. Secondly, I've been coming here for over a couple months now and not only is the ambience great, but the culture in there is alive and thriving. I'm happy that we have this store in our area!
This place is cool
OMG first time and I know I'm coming back very soon ❤️

An excellent place to buy and get together to play cards & games.  For all ages.  Highly recommend.

...and there's parking in the back.

Great store that goes above and beyond.
Their ordering process is easy, order ahead online.
The staff is friendly and actively seeks to help.
And the bathrooms are cleanly with toiletries.

Plenty of activity even on Wednesday night
I went in there just to look and they gave me a dollar card as well as a pack of top loaders all for free. Amazing company!
The place is good but 50% back in cash for trading in cards is a bit absurd good prices for selling though
Amazing store. Showroom is stocked with board games, TCGs and miniatures for war games. The play space is spacious, with weekly events for popular games of all kind. Staff are lovely too!
Fantastic selection! Chill vibes, nice variety of paint colors and brands. Little of everything for every gamer.
They are great here

I come here often to play commander with friends.  They have a large play space in the back that is always clean, the staff is always willing to help and is knowledgeable about the card games and board games in the store, and prices for magic singles are fair.  They also sell snack and alcohol for consumption in the play area, which I find to be a bonus.  All that to say I have been very happy with this store since I discovered it 5-6 years ago, so if your in the area and looking for a local games store, check the Meeple out :).

As a new MTG player, I visited Meeple while looking to learn how to play commander. On my first day there, the employees made an amazing first impression by helping me pick out new cards to optimize the precon I bought earlier online. This gentleman named Sean took a special interest in helping me and took about 30 minutes hand picking some of the best and most fun cards in the format. I walked away feeling so genuinely helped. By the next time I came, every employee knew my name and greeted me welcomingly.

I can't understate how nice the experience is at Meeple compared to other LGSs. Customer service, inventory management (online database of all their cards and buying system), points system, drinks on tap, snacks and refreshments, spacious play area, and fun and free commander events every Thursday.

Also, big shoutouts all the other amazing employees there who make it feel like home: Alex, Preston, Gaven, and Thomas, just to name a few, but all the staff is wonderful.

Make this your LGS if you're in or around CLT! You won't regret it.
Mighty Meeple is arguably the best LGS in the Concord/Charlotte area, great atmosphere, professional workers and awesome scheduling for card games throughout the week. Highly recommend!!!

After years of being away , my son got me hooked back into Magic the Gathering.  If you are looking for a super friendly environment this is the place.  GIGANTIC selection , very knowledgeable staff , and tons of great people of all ages.  Wish I could give it higher than 5 stars, as this place deserves it.
I’ve been coming here for a little under a year now when I started playing magic. The workers and the community welcomed me with open arms. I feel like this place is like a safe place away from home.

Me and a Buddy came to meeple to just buy some cards. They had a commander night that day and we both played in it. 6 months later I have a large group of friends and a set date we go out to play every week. Customer Service makes you feel special in a way no other LGS can. If your thinking of a go to spot for Commander, Draft, Modern, or Standard: Mighty Meeple si the way to go. Can't Beat It!!!!
The guy with long hair and glasses is pretty cool, and always has something to talk about whenever I come in.
Wonderful people, and great selection of different games for everyone to enjoy
Best game store ever Shaun the manger definitely one of the most helpful and enthusiastic people I’ve ever met amazing store a must visit if you play any TCG games
Shawn knows his stuff, best place to play any tcg

My first time here, and I felt completely out of place. I was ignored the entire time, despite the store not being particularly busy. When I first walked in, there were a few people at the front near the glass cases and register, so I decided to browse the board games in the back while waiting for the foot traffic to settle. (By the way, great selection!) Once some people left, I returned to the front to check out the TCG cards. I stood there, clearly looking at the display, yet not a single acknowledgment—no “Hey, let me know if you need anything,” not even eye contact. I totally understand if employees are occupied or need a moment before assisting a customer, but usually, there’s at least some form of communication.
I’m not sure if I was ignored because I was a female customer alone or if this is just standard practice, but it was definitely noticeable that others were greeted and helped—just not me. Maybe there’s a secret password I didn’t know? Either way, not a great first impression for someone new to the community.

I gave 2 stars because I was genuinely excited to check this place out, and they do have an awesome selection. Unfortunately, I left empty handed and feeling like my presence was an inconvenience. Not exactly the welcoming experience I was hoping for.

Market price for this product on release day? $10. How much was Meeple selling for? $35, over THREE TIMES retail price. This local game store is worse than regular scalpers because they are out here normalizing insane prices. The surprise box that released today is supposed to be a $20 product, and they are selling it for $65. I understand a small upcharge, like $5-$10 per item, but this is out of hand. The manager at this store should feel ashamed for taking advantage of their customers. The only reason why I bought one tin is so I could get one for my sibling, who hasn't been able to get a single prismatic evolutions product since release. This is absolutely disgusting behavior, and I hope other people don't give in and pay such obnoxious prices. I will never be bringing my business here again.
Friendly staff, easy place for trading in cards with their online system!
Atmosphere l, workers, and general patrons are super helpful friendly and prices are nice
Shaun, Thomas, and Alex are the best guys at the store if you anything from them they got you
The best board game store I’ve ever been to they have anything you’d ever need from snacks to model kits

The store is absolutely incredible with wonderful owner & staff. They have an insanely good selection of board games and trading cards. They also host a plethora of events throughout the week, and have grown an amazing gaming community.
Everyone is always so welcoming and helpful! A perfect place to play games at!

I've been to many local game stores over the past 15 years, and Mighty Meeple has an above and beyond experience. The people here are great to talk to and get to know. They have many of the comforts of home; with snacks, drinks, and even adult beverages! I've been coming to Meeple for years at this point and look forward to going at least once a week. My friends and I consider ourselves "Meeple People," and appreciate everything they provide.

Come check them out!
Called them and the offered 450 to 600$ for a 300,000$ pokemon card the 1 edition Charizard yea they are nice irl but tried to rip me off

Easy five star experience at Mighty Meeple.  Huge playroom in the back and a great selection of cards, board games, and accessories.  The team working there are great with every guest and I overheard a lot of great conversations.  One guy in particular went way out of his way to make my kid’s weekend on his birthday and he can’t wait to go back even though it’s almost an hour from our house!

I came to mighty meeple for the first time to compete in locals for the first time, the staff was very friendly and people were great! The tall handsome guy with long hair and glasses was especially helpful and funny and cute, definitely coming back again! Dattebayo! 👊

Was going there for almost 5 yrs got banned due to me arguing about the grading standards being insanely strict to the level of scamming (other reviewers talk about it)and owner called me two days later and said not to come back didn’t ask anything about what happened just said I cussed out an employee. Not hurt prices there have been terrible and all the new stuff out of stock constantly but a good clean space to play. Several employee especially the male with long dark hair have bad attitude clearly a work culture thing. Also if you want prize support don't go to the regular events it’s the everyone gets something format.
I had a great time with friendly people at the mtg ladies night

I don't usually write reviews - but this place is review worthy.

The space is expansive, incredibly clean, well laid out. They have everything you need no matter your niche in card games, board games, or anything gaming honestly! The staff is incredibly helpful, and friendly as well, which is always an A+ for me.

If you're staying for a game night, there are drinks and snacks available, including a nice offering of adult beverages as well;  depending on the nights for crowds of only 21+.

Mighty meeple deserves 10/5 stars, bar none.

This is a cool place if you like playing competitive card games.  Even if you don't, They have a huge back room with plenty of space to play board games.  There is no cost.... Just the first come, first served for spaces.  The store at the front is pretty cool too with lots of games, dungeons and dragon stuff, and collectible cards with booster packs available.  They also have a few alcoholic beverages on tap for when you're hanging out with friends.
Went to a magic night, it was a lot of fun,
Great game store, stopped in when out of town to play board games and had a wonderful time.
Solid LGS. Great selection.
Great place for magic the gathering! I enjoy that I can participate in Ladies Night and get to know my community! Great staff, great service!
Great place to sale your pokemon cards
False advertisement. They downgrade your cards, if they're new and they lie about what they will offer you, they dont take cards that they say they do on their website ridiculously obnoxious .
This store is awesome! It’s nearby where I live, and it’s like a hidden gem of charlotte! This place is so cool.

I called ahead to make sure a product was in stock and was told multiple times they had 10 boxes in stock.  I drove 30 minutes to get there and they couldn't find their inventory and only had 1.  Very disappointing they gave me bad info and I spent an hour driving.
Great place nice and helpful

Wow.  This place is simply fantastic.  Dave + Eric and crew are true professionals.  Honest and open and extremely fair, both buying and selling.  Zero gatekeeping if you're new to a game. Saw some candid customer interactions and it was the same across the boards in terms of helpfulness and understanding.  Huge selection, and giant gameroom.  Well done.

This is my favorite game store like ever. I don’t have the time/opportunity to go play at all, but their massive gaming area is awesome, they serve beer?!?! and their selection of Warhammer stuff is great. Oh and SO MANY paints! And dice! And hobby supplies!

I really appreciate their loyalty program as well, as it helps to save some money ;)

I’ve only had good experiences here, and I’d definitely recommend this location.

One of my favorite MTG card shops. Staff is friendly even if you're new, selection is good and includes other TCG games, Dungeons and Dragons, board games, etc. I also appreciate online ordering and selling of individual cards helpfulbsoni can place an order before driving over.

They have tables for general gaming in the back with drinks and snacks in case you need them and daily events.
Love shopping here for board games and also playing board games with friends in the area. Highly recommend stopping by and checking it out if you're into strategic board games!

The only place I. The area for board games AND miniature painting supplies. Great staff.

I spend WAY too much money here
Come here alot and love it
Spacious with friendly employees
Great selection!

Visited for the first time yesterday. I’m from out of town and I wish I had a game store like the Mighty Meeple! Great selection of games. We were looking for a recommendation for our group and the staff was so helpful. They knew what they were talking about and we never felt rushed or pressured. We went with one of their recommendations and it was PERFECT! My husband plays DnD and was impressed with their selection of paint and dice. We will be back next time we’re in town!
Very cool place
My teenagers spend a lot of time here and love it.

The Mighty Meeple is far and away the best game store in the Charlotte Metro area, if not the entire state of North Carolina. It is my immediate recommendation to anyone looking for a space to engage with board games, trading card games, miniatures games, TTRPGs, and more.

The store has an excellent selection of product at fair prices, including a generous rewards points system. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable of the products, and most employees are passionate enough about the products that they’ll be the same people you see playing in the store. Dave, one of the owners, is extraordinarily friendly and present in the store, and goes above and beyond to accommodate different groups and individuals to ensure they have a welcoming, safe, and most of all fun experience.

The Mighty Meeple offers a community play space with a wide selection of games to demo at no cost. The play area is large compared to other stores, and it is always tidy and clean. They have sections dedicated to miniatures games as well so that there is no competing for play space. Their concession area is well-stocked with various snacks, baked goods, and beverages. If you drink, they also have a nice selection of beer and ciders on draught, as well as a selection of wine.

The store actively supports and fosters communities. They have been immensely supportive of our efforts to kickstart a Pauper Magic: the Gathering night, providing free prize support and sectioning off an area of the play space to reserve for our use. This is the case for many different games, not just Magic. Mighty Meeple has an event of some kind going on almost every day, so that those interested in meeting up with like-minded individuals have a space to do so. They put in the effort to maintain an impressive scheduling board in their play space so that you can be comfortable in knowing when different events of interest are happening. The Mighty Meeple is an important “third place” for many of its patrons and does a great job maintaining that role. I have met many of my close friends through events that Meeple has offered.

The Mighty Meeple is the gold standard for game stores, and I encourage you to check it out.
Great people loved the dice selection

Yesterday was my first time ever stopping by this shop that I had no clue was there.  actually the people from the video game world in the mall recommended me to stop by here and my overall experience was great.
The guy behind the counter that I did not get his name was very friendly and he took his time to take out all the cards in the case that I wanted to take a look at while running the cash register at the same time.
Found some awesome Blastoise cards to add to my Blastoise collection.
I0/10 will highly recommend and I definitely will be back.
great game store we found while vacationing in the area. helpful, friendly, and knowledgeable staff. highly recommend if you're an MTG player or fan of table top games.

If I could give this place 10 stars, I would. As vacationers to the area and avid MTG fans, we had to make a stop. The staff are absolutely incredible!  They found out we were vacationing for our son’s birthday and gave him such special treatment at the store!

With all of that said, the store is every gamer’s dreamland! There’s a huge room in the back where they hold MTG tournaments. Huge inventory of single cards, great variety of games in general, and stock of all things Magic was impressive and reasonably priced!

Incredibly helpful staff, a great collection of singles, and one of the only card / game shops around that you accrue store credit. Easily one of the best game stores around charlotte, and worth the 40-60 minute drive for me.
This is my favorite place to hang with friends and play games.

I've been coming to this store for years now and it's always been the peak of customer service! The employees treat everyone with the utmost hospitality, especially the guy who works up front with glasses and long hair, he is always so helpful and incredibly friendly! To anyone looking for a great place to play games, this is the place to be!
The Meeple is a great place to hang out with friends and play games like Commander and other games, the staff is fun and very helpfull and nice

I have shopped here alot recently because of the good selection of singles, but the issue is how I'm treated by the employees. A guy with long hair and glasses acts like new customers are unintelligent and treats them badly. I asked about store credit on cards out of pack and he called them lightly played, whenever they were fresh from a pack, and near mint wasn't a category. I shouldn't be treated like some casual because I'm new to the shop. Most of the staff is very nice but there are 2 employees who are very rude. Every time I come here I have more negative things to say than positive, because of a few bad apples. 80% of the employees are awesome but it's the ones I run in to regularly that are very discriminatory and try to gouge the customer. I also play a certain family of magic and the clerk talked down about it and tried to tell me I was wasting my time when what I play is what I WANT TO PLAY!! Instead of putting down my interest and trying to short me on trade ins they should be boosting the community and embracing it. Honestly I will never be shopping here again after this.
Great gaming store with good stock and prices
Great local gaming shop.  Lots of games to try out in the demo rack!
Extensive stock of a lot of different games...all levels!
A great place to play, huge playspace, great employees, great environment. The place is always clean, Dave is a great guy, and I always look forward to my days there!
Friendly staff, good selection of games, and they have a huge first come first serve area in the back to play games at (sometimes it reserved, I think for magic tournaments)
The play area is huge, and the selection is great.

Absolutely the worst game store experience I've ever had in my life.  I asked if I could buy a product, and they had to ask the event manager (as it would have been an exception to a rule).  I'd have been OK with a no, but I am not okay with being looked up and down and then getting a no (that was passed along to me rather than  directly).

Obviously, different experiences can occur, but for my dime, I won't be back.

Mighty Meeple has a great selection of tcg, ttrpgs, miniatures, and dice. The one thing I will criticize is the employee uniforms. I hope they ditch em and let the employees wear lax clothing like every other Board game store.Edit: weird opinion— but I am a very anti uniform person.

If you need any contemporary board games or AD&D guides or dice, this is a good place to go.  They have plenty of shelves with stock to look at and you can easily access the boxes to read up on the game.  They have gaming space in the back too.
Nice, clean store.
Great hobby shop with a focus on TCG’s.  Owner helped with an issue and made the experience enjoyable.  Plan of going back for more tournaments!!!

This is an excellent game store that caters to multiple niches. Not only does it have Magic the Gathering and D&D books, it has plenty of boards games and other specialized roleplaying games to choose from as well.
awesome place.  Employees and other players alike are super friendly and most events have plenty of people to fire.  10/10

Much bigger than I expected! Lots of games to browse, huge dice selection ranging from low cost to high end. Lots of supplies for tabletop RPG like figurines and environment.

Prices seem fair. I appreciated the unboxed games displayed at the front. Staff was mostly friendly, particularly the person at the register when checking out.
What a great store!! Huge selection of games and stuff, well presented, very friendly an helpful staff. And what I never experienced in any board game store before: they have a Bar and sell beer 🍺 👍

The Meeple is an exceptional LGS in every regard. They have definitely earned the “featured LGS” designation on the WoTC website. The shop is nicely sized, well stocked, impeccably clean and bright, and the play space is awesome. The staff are approachable, knowledgeable, and helpful. As someone newer to MTG it has been really hard to find a welcoming and accessible shop to play at and meet new players. The Meeple team works hard to make people comfortable, help them improve their game, and help them meet new players. The staff pitch play nights and get excited when you show up- they even walked me around and introduced me to some regular players my first game night to help me find a pod and get started. They also have a LOT of inventory. Whatever I need is typically in stock. Are the singles/prices higher than online? Yes. But I happily pay a bit more (typically ~10% more than the lowest TCG Player price) in exchange for all of the additional value we get from the shop. Some reviews about the shop being discriminatory or exclusive surprised me - as a regular shopper and new weekly Commander player, I always see a very diverse player population and the staff are very welcoming. Don’t give up on the local play groups! Try the Meeple!
Love it, I'm from a board gaming family and this place is paradise!
The place is always clean, usually pretty stocked with products and snack, and the employees are approachable.

First time coming in today and AMAZING customer service. Only complaint is wishing the stock consisted of more anime CCG such as Naruto Bundai CCG. Other than that, prices are good, customer service was fantastic. Ended up buying a small MHA TCG Box and left with the biggest smile on my face. Will definitely be back soon!!!
Great, friendly staff and board/card game products. I haven't been to a game night there yet but word of mouth has highly recommended it for Magic the Gathering.

I love The Mighty Meeple, its always been my favorite place to play MTG, Warhammer, D&D, Pokemon, and most recently The One Piece TCG. The owners are very friendly and albeit a bit strange, (In a good way of course haha). I believe they have made one of if not the best hobby shops in NC. They will always have my business and time for any of their fun events that come up. To all the staff and owners of The Mighty Meeple i thank you for bringing such a great experience and alot of fun memories from day one and beyond! ❤

When I moved to Charlotte this was the first LGS I went to, and for a few weeks, it was okay. One day I came in for an event with my boyfriend and was discriminated against by the owner and his mother for being LGBT. I was told I could not have the product I paid for and asked to leave, no reason given. I went back a few weeks later to pick up an online order I had placed 30 minutes before closing (and it was a one card order) and the owner’s mother again discriminated against me by locking the door once seeing my boyfriend get out of the car as well. Not only have I been shown disgusting behavior towards me personally but the store price gouges like no other I have ever seen on TCG single buying and selling. On top of this the recent Disney Lorcana release that was supposed to be released to the public, the store took the inventory they got, opened up boxes, and are reselling some of the singles for almost 500% of their TCG Player market price. They’re stopping me from enjoying my hobbies and everyone from getting a chance to play Lorcana and get their hands on cards without paying an arm and a leg. And before you think anything else, plenty of stores are selling the products at the correct pricing and still making profit. This store is just filled with greedy, rude, and homophobic staff, it’s 2023, it’s disgusting…
Very helpful and friendly staff, it was busy but I still felt like I was being taken care of.
Nice staff. Nice inventory

Had a great experience at this store! The owner is super friendly and the building is one of the absolute nicest LGS I have ever been to they have a huge supply for every one of the major hobbies including Magic, Pokemon, Warhammer, D&D, mini painting, and many more. The employees are super helpful and friendly as well and they have beer and other beverages for those who are interested in that. Definitely an amazing stop and worth the drive and the stop on a long road trip!
Huge store with a fine selection
They stopped selling disc golf stuff unfortunately I was stopping by to get a putter they had a decent selection idk why they got rid of it
We love this place!

I’m a Pokémon based YouTuber and I was really surprised when I saw their selection. Fantastic cards from all eras and very good pricing. What’s more is they buy bulk which gives collectors a chance to exchange worthless cards for some credit towards cards they might not otherwise have bought! Really enjoyed my experience !

Very cool shop with tons of play space, concessions, and an awesome MTG and tabletop game selection. Staff has always been super helpful as well every time I’ve been here. Highly recommend visiting if you’re looking for a tabletop gaming home base.

Absolutely adore this store. We go in about once a month, maybe twice, and feel like kids in a toy store. There is so much to offer for any kind of game you might want. From cards to table top to fun family game nights. As well as accessories and toys!
One of the best card stores in Charlotte for sure. Friendly knowledgeable staff! Go Mighty Meeps!
Nice selection of games, dice and all your hobby needs. Super friendly staff

I travel a lot for work, and get to visit a lot of game stores. Granted I've only been to this one once, but very good first impression. Greeted when walking through the door but then left alone to browse, just the way I like it. Good selection (Best in store Bolt Action selection I've seen), and huge play area with what I assume is evening beer service. Good prices. Recommended.
Really chill vibe. Alcohol and snacks while you are playing games, and a good selection of products.
I enjoy every visit but live rather far away, but if you live in the Concord area, give the place a try.
Great selection of Magic cards, games and accessories! It's my favorite place to shop for gaming gear! Very friendly and helpful staff too! We drive about 2 hours to come here. Definitely worth it!
Plenty of great people and a huge inventory selection. Great for events
Although I had never been to the store I called to ask some questions and Chad answered the phone and was one of the most helpful people I have ever dealt with.

Such wonderful staff and owners here at the Mighty Meeple. I got to attend the pre release back in February and when my friends and I wanted to do a draft at home. We realized we didn't have enough lands they graciously let us borrow a bunch for the event. Again extremely amazing group here. Will continue to go here and support this establishment

The Mighty Meeple is awesome! A must for all your gaming needs ! Recently checked it out for the Phyrexia pre release after not playing magic for awhile. Everyone there was welcoming and such a fun environment! Staff was great! I look forward to attending more events and getting all my supplies there. I would recommend this place whether you are just getting into card/board games or if you have been enjoying them for years !

Love coming here for adventure league dnd and Friday night magic. Employees are amazing, always very friendly. They have a section in the back for activities aka dnd, magic, pokemon and alot other things. In there they have a small food/drink area where you can buy beer off the tap (about 6 different kinds, might be more) or Gatorade, soda, juice, crackers, chips, bakery goods and alot other's.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you for your review Alexander! We are so glad that you enjoy The Mighty Meeple!

reviews_data.review_text: Great store and layout, loved the selection of games and paints.  Want to come back and play some board games soon!
Nice selection. Prices a little high
Fantastic place.  Has a huge game room and the staff is wonderful.

Love it.  Everyone is really nice and inviting. Great vibes all around and a fantastic collection of merchandise to purchase at pretty reasonable prices plus other cool more expensive things if you like to splurge. So
Many. Dice. All the dice. Dice made of metal, wood, gem stones! Amd of course regular normal dice sections. Highly recommend 👌
My partner and I come all the time. We love it here and are so glad we get to support this business.

Customer service has gone way down in the past few years.  This used to be one of my favorite places to play, but it takes a very long time to get service.  Also, forcing customers to use the single computer to purchase singles is not the way to go.  MTG singles are almost always in stock, but the prices are very high.
Great selection of games and products and a lot of room to play
An excellent source for several types of gaming(cards, miniatures, D&D, etc). The people are well versed and the products are a fair(and sometimes better) price compared to other places.
Great place, huge selection of games, open box play to test before you buy, and a great selection of local taps.
Very large selection of games and miniatures.
Elves and dragons and paints oh my!!! Clean store with friendly staff who seem very knowledgeable. Great miniature paint selection and a cool clearance section with some good deals.
Great place to play, nice online selection, friendly staff.
Pretty neat store. The game area is the best I've ever seen; it has an actual bar for beer and snacks.
Great local game store
It's okay, lots of people come here.  If you like magic the gathering, you can fulfill that addiction adequately here.
Great selection of board games and more! Perfect for the omni gamer.

First time coming here- and now its my FAVORITE local game store. Awesome diverse selection, knowledgeable staff with great recommendations!!  And seriously- the selection. I was super impressed of not only the brand new games that they had in stock (Marvel Dice Throne, Ark Nova) but also the selection of lesser knowns (Tiny Epic series). And the expansions- all the expansions. I also got a great recommendation for teaching my kid simple mechanics and an easy learn to a phenomenal game (Tsuro). Very impressed. Will definitely be back.  *high five*
Great place to sell your MTG cards

Awesome place to pick up new board and card games. The staff is really friendly and helpful. I've only been there twice but everyone I met has been very nice and the place seems to have a good family environment as well. Great place to play Magic the Gathering if you are into it as well as D&D and many other games!

The Mightiest of all the Meeples!

Update:  Still the Mightiest
My son and grandson had a great time playing Pokemon me not so much
Great store for all your gaming needs plus some super nice folks who run and own the store.
Always clean and well kept and a great environment for whatever your tabletop gaming niche may be
This place is super great. Great selection of board games, really helpful staff.

This place is always packed with people, products, and events. There's something for everyone here, but what I appreciate most is the sophisticated organization of buying and selling Magic cards with the Mighty Meeple. Everyone is super friendly and informative, and they even have snacks and alcoholic beverages for your next game night or campaign.

Store is clean and service is consistent, prices are slightly higher than TCG average and they won't take anything above light play unless you open in store. This can be problematic if you have reserve list cards. Overall a good store.

Awesome spot for fans of MtG and Pokemon TCG. Massive playing table setup in the back and 99% of the staff is very friendly and helpful.
Plenty of game dice/pieces, frisbee golf and playing mats to choose from. I recommend highly to anyone looking for a new one stop shop  for most TCG needs

Everyone that works here is super kind and accommodating. They make an effort to learn your name, answer questions, look up stock, or share their game knowledge. They will not hesitate to do a special order for you. They have an amazing selection of MTG cards, both in pack form or singles. They have a huge selection of board games, and they have several of them open in the game room for you to try out before you buy. Their game room is huge with SO many tables. Even on a crowded weekend evening, I've never struggled to find a place to sit. You can show up for events on their calendar, or anytime for casual play with friends. They serve draft beer, sodas, snacks, and local baked goods. I really like this place!

Great gaming store.  Wide selection of games and a large gaming room.  Layout is great too.  Signing up for their membership (which is free) offers points that can be redeemed for discounts.  The best gaming store in Charlotte.

The ultimate hobby store - massive, well lit spaces with knowledgeable staff and enormous resources.
Warhammer, Marvel Crisis Protocol, MTG, Legion, Board Games? Of course they have the standards.
Tournament play, open play and casual play? Absolutely!
But for fun bonuses - they have an amazing beer and wine selection, an epic disc golf selection, some less known but great games like malifaux and bolt action, and merch to boot.
There is no game store like this. Go!
Super nice/helpful employees and huge miniature selection and paints.
Excellent stock and knowledgeable staff.

I always enjoy coming in here, even though I'm not hardcore into cards or tabletop anything. The staff are always pleasant, the atmosphere softly buzzing, with a jazzy selection of games and dice - and don't forget plushies. Their refreshments include some unique local brews (Red Clay, anyone?) and they are well priced. 10/10 for space, variety, and ambiance!
Went to get dice, they had a lot of dice!

Tried to call in and ask a question and was responded with some rude kid. When asked a simple question he could not answer me and get so frustrated he hung up. There are other options in town and I would go there.
reviews_data.owner_answer: I'm really sorry for the experience you had. We appreciate your feedback and we will handle this situation.

reviews_data.review_text: Amazing place! Big space with lots of room to browse their extensive stock. Something here for all types of gamers and miniature painters. I was excited to find they had the full lines of GW, Vallejo and Army Painter paints! The staff was also very friendly and attentive. Definitely check them out!

I went into Mighty Meeple looking for some Pokémon cards. Ness was the biggest help I could have ever asked for. I found exactly what I was looking for and she went the extra mile to help me out. Great place with an amazing selection of cards. I will be coming back for sure!
Great gaming place.
Great place! This place is HUGE! They have all your board game and d&d stuff you could ever need! They even have disc golf

Love MM. Looks even better after the renovation. Stock is pretty great and they are clearly open to trying new games as Malifaux and Bolt Action both seem to have escalated there. Always worth the trip and with a pretty good burger place right across the street from them.
Inventory was not great but did have a large selection of different types of games. Prices were the same or better on Amazon sadly. Staff was friendly and store was well organized.
Our go-to spot for gaming.

EDITED TO ADD: While I was VERY upset by the incident in my original review, I thoroughly enjoy collecting and playing Magic The Gathering, especially with my two oldest kiddos, and refused to let one incident ruin it for me. I proceeded to visit a few more times over the course of a week trading in cards and purchasing the ones I needed for the MANY Commander decks I'm building. I was quite pleasantly surprised during my most recent visit the other day to learn that I've purchased enough that I was rewarded with store credit, which really helped me with my deck building. I still think that night one of the employees could have spared a couple minutes to sell one card, especially since they had a backroom completely full of players and 15 minutes left, but so far I like the store and am glad I discovered it so quickly after moving here. So I'm updating the stars for my review.

Original review:
There was ABSOLUTELY NO EXCUSE for not taking a couple of minutes to sell ONE card when there were TWO employees there, still FIFTEEN MINUTES until closing, AND the back room was FULL of people still playing!!! ONE of the two employees COULD have taken a couple minutes to sell ONE card while the other continued sweeping while the back room was FULL of people still playing!!! IF I had arrived with only 5 minutes to closing AND the back room was EMPTY instead of FULL of players, THEN it would have been understandable to say come back tomorrow or order online, but NOT when there was still FIFTEEN MINUTES LEFT AND A BACK ROOM COMPLETELY FULL OF PEOPLE STILL PLAYING THEIR GAMES!!!!! That was absolute BS!!!! Such a disappointment for the ONLY Magic The Gathering card shop in the area.
I have built  all my my decks from this store and everyone is and was so helpfull i highly  recommend  this place for all of your mtg singles

I enjoy going to this store to look for D & D miniatures! The location is close to my house so it's super easy to visit and look for new miniatures for my adventuring needs! I also restock paints and paint supplies for my miniatures. The selection is very good. I wish they had Game Colors by Vallejo but so far I can't find a store that does!
Greta store lots of selection and snack/drinks on site for long gaming sessions.

Better selection and generally equal to or better prices than the other game stores anywhere nearby. All of the employees were exceptionally nice and helpful. This place is the best game store I've found anywhere in or near Charlotte.
Very polite staff and clean store

Mighty meeple is vary nice place to play and the staff is knowledgeable on most games  and pleasant to be around If they do not have stuff they can special order . Lots of snacks and beer added to menu
Really Good people
Cool selection of table top games
Great place for Magic the Gathering, the owner is very pleasant.
Great people always willing to help. The much larger gaming area and store area are amazing

They have a fairly generous selection of just about everything. The game room in the back is pretty cool, although I have not had the chance to play any matches here yet. The staff and managers are very friendly as well.
Was a pleasure playing in the 2k tournament this past Saturday. Great shop. Excellent employees.

Great selection of games to browse, as well as dice... and Frisbee golf disks.  There is a large room to try out games (they have events but I haven't attended any) and purchase drinks and snacks.  The staff have been kind and helpful.

Today I went to the mighty meeple to finish my King Ghidorah deck. The man at the front was very helpful. But after he helped me a lot with my deck I had a chance to talk to the owner of the store. And he asked me why did I leave a one star. I explained to him that one of his staff members was aggravating the s*** out of me. And was gonna cause me to jump over a counter top. He was very courteous and listening to what I had to say and he expressed that he was going to do his best to fix this problem so it doesn't persist. I'm going to give this place four stars instead of one, merely because the guy who was at the front and the manager and other staff member who spoke to me.

But the future will tell.
Great place to game! Lots of tables and terrain to use, great staff too!
Store was so awesome, great selection of products and the staff was very friendly and helpful. 10/10 would reccomend
The Mighty Meeple is the premier gaming location in the region.  The selection is vast.  The playing area is full of people but never crowded.  They demo games and have excellent giveaways.
Every one was so nice, friendly & helpful. What a great place to buy & play games.

Sweet lil shop, has alot of play space and tables. Not a fan of having to type into a computer to buy a card though. When dealing with TCGs or any collectables it should be more personable imo. When you want to buy a card you should just be able to point and say "I want that one." Not, ok well you have to put it in the computer and then bring me a piece of paper. Like, no, thats your employees job, not the customers.
Great selection of board games.

I went in to buy my daughters Pokémon cards but had no idea what I was doing. The workers were helpful, patient and explained things clearly. They have evening meetups that change throughout the week. This is a great place to buy board games.

Nice, large, clean store with a big selection of games, gaming supplies, and trading cards. Staff is very friendly and helpful, and it looks like they have a large gaming space in the back for tournaments. Will definitely be coming back.
Great place.   Spend entirely too much time here.   Nice place to play games
Love this store, they had every card I was looking for and they were really nice and minimally mansplainy
Wide selection and knowledgeable employees. Decent pricing too.
Awesome place for all things nerd.  The mini bar and gaming area are top notch and the staff is great.

reviews_data.review_text: They forgot to put multiple cards in my order that i had already paid for. This is the 2nd time this has happened! When i tried calling them to remedy the situation they hung up on me. Will not be returning.
Staff is always friendly. Place is always clean. The woman who was at the snack station was a joy to purchase from. I love this place

First time in the store.

Tyler was super helpful and staff very friendly.

Huge area in the back with lots of tables for TTRPGs,  MtG, etc

Reasonable pricing as well on all things gaming. They also have art and minis from local artists. Major props to them for supporting local,  HUZZAH!!!!!

IMO best game shop within 20min of Charlotte. They support online order of magic singles from their website and they usually have a healthy stock of MTG product in general. Board game and Warhammer selection is awe inspiring. Staff is great and knowledgeable. They also stock a lot of Gunpla. You could find at least one gift for all of your nerdy friends and family.
Still great, nice and helpful employees all around good experience
Amazing place! Im new to collect cards and selling them and they made the process easy with the online buy list on their website!!
Nice clean shop, not like the ones I'm used to. Staff is friendly and they host fun events
Thank you for creating a safe environment for our children to play!

I've been going to this store for years playing 40k but recently getting back into MtG seeing their prices being so absurdly high and trying to trade in some of my old collection only getting 40% value in cash and automatic grading as LP just doesnt make me want to buy mtg products from them anymore. The play space in the back and their selection of other games is very nice and I do still purchase their warhammer products from time to time.

Great place to pick up single cards, packs, and starter decks for multiple tcg series. Also has a huge selection of board games, puzzles, and gunpla. The play space can get a little crowded and loud during popular times but they have a nice variety of snacks and beverages available.
Best comic and gaming shop in / near Charlotte.
Good staff and a good vibe.
Hunter & Misty were awesome help! Shop is huge and has an amazing selection and play space.  Thank you for the friendly service, can't wait to make this our FLGS
I love getting mtg cards from here and playing a few pick up games with new friends to be
Great staff great selection

The Mighty Meeple is a fantastic game store! It’s well-kept and has a great atmosphere, with lots of people clearly enjoying themselves. The snack bar is a great feature. Perfect for longer gaming sessions! I also appreciated how neatly organized the Warhammer terrain items were. Great place to shop, play, and hang out!
Solid shop with knowledgeable and friendly staff
Great place. Amazing selection. Great people. ignore the 1 star andys who think they own the world. I've been to 3 of their WH40k tourneys and the atmosphere is amazing.
store looks cool online, but i called and staff member was kinda rude and dismissive,

I adore this shop! The staff isn't just professional, but super nice and extremely helpful! Place is clean and fully stocked. Plenty of seats to play any games. Just awesome! Customer for life!! Been coming here for a while. It's a great local place with super friendly and knowledgeable staff. They run great events. I'm in love with their two-headed giant prerelease. Their King of the Hill Commarder Sealed League is a lot of fun too. I could ramble on but just know it's a great place.
Great store with plenty of space for product and a wonderful event space.  Everyone we have encountered there has been friendly, helpful and welcoming.  Will return for sure.

Mighty Meeple is an absolute treasure! My son and I play Magic: The Gathering here at least once a week, and over time, it has become so much more than just a game store—they truly feel like part of our extended family. The team is always kind, helpful, and genuinely fun to be around. The store is clean, well-stocked, and offers a great selection of games, cards, and accessories.

As a woman who enjoys gaming, I also really appreciate how welcoming and comfortable the environment is. It can be intimidating to step into a space where there aren’t many women players, but I’ve always felt completely at ease here. The community is respectful and inclusive, and that makes a huge difference.

Whether you’re a new player or a longtime fan, Mighty Meeple makes everyone feel at home. We’re so grateful to have a place like this in our community. Shout out to the regular commander night crew - Sean, Alex x 2, Thomas, and Preston! We appreciate your guys for all that you do.

This is a wonderful, well-run, independently-owned local gaming and art supply store with a vibrant and inclusive atmosphere. They also have a small convenience store and beer tap inside (open most days, maybe not Monday?). It can get very busy, so be careful where you park and pay attention to the signage from the neighboring businesses. If you're unsure, just touch base with the helpful staff! Flag them down if you need to, they also have an online presence and that is usually hopping, so they are rarely just hanging out, though I have always been greeted and even remembered each time I go in. I'm totally an introvert and I prefer not to be talked to so I notice when people do... because I try to melt into the floor 😉 You can also place an order online to pick up in the store and that is probably the approach that most people use. We usually go here to get painting supplies for miniatures or for trading cards. The prices are tied to online markets and demand in a pretty transparent and fair way, but the cards are also graded conservatively compared to online sellers so the prices are competitive, especially considering it's a brick and mortar that provides services and community (and multiple local jobs) that online retailers do not. They host multiple sanctioned and promotional events and provide a large gaming space that welcomes people to just hang out and play, build, or paint in the back. If the table is reserved for an event it will probably say so. I was nervous at first because I didn't know the rules but the main courtesy/rule I've noticed is probably no food or drink near other people's stuff or in the front of the store, though they are allowed. Other specific play rules and things are clearly posted. It's worth checking out the location and events if you can, including some very worthwhile community fundraisers. There are also ladies nights and events geared towards younger kids, and you can find those on their Facebook page. 💖💕

Amazing place to buy and play at. It doesn't matter your game they have it or a group of people playing it. I love the Warhammer tournaments and meeting up with a friend on a Friday night for a brew and quick game of AoS.
Knowledgeable and super friendly staff. Great place to get the cards and supplies I need and then tons of room in the play area to have a few games and hang out with my friends or make new ones.

Mighty Meeple has been my go-to local game store for years, and it continues to stand out as one of the best in the area. Whether you’re a long-time player or just getting into tabletop games, this store offers a welcoming and engaging experience that’s hard to beat. I primarily participate in their Magic: The Gathering Modern events, and the player base around this format is excellent. The community strikes a rare balance—players are highly competitive but also approachable and encouraging. It’s not uncommon to see newer players receiving helpful advice from seasoned veterans, creating a healthy and positive environment for growth. The staff at Mighty Meeple have never been anything but kind, respectful, and helpful. They foster a space where everyone feels welcome, provided they treat others with the same respect. The tone set by the team makes a noticeable difference—whether you’re trading cards, joining a tournament, or just browsing, you feel valued. Mighty Meeple runs a packed weekly calendar filled with events for various trading card games. The owners, Dave and Tom, bring unique strengths to the store. Dave is the friendly, welcoming face who greets you at the door and makes everyone feel at home. Tom handles the business operations and, while more reserved initially, proves to be warm and genuinely passionate about the store and its players once you get to know him. The selection of Magic singles, sealed products, board games, and accessories is among the best I’ve seen at a local game store. They stock both popular and hard-to-find items, and the inventory is clearly curated with serious gamers in mind. Their trade-in policy is tough but fair—they accept cards in Light Play condition and offer bonus credit if you opt for store credit over cash, which is a great option for regular customers. The play area is one of the largest in the region, comfortably accommodating large events and casual groups alike. The tables are clean, well-maintained, and always buzzing with activity in the evenings. They also offer a library of board games available for in-store play, making it easy to try new games before committing to a purchase. The store is frequently packed during peak hours, which speaks volumes about the community that’s been built here. Mighty Meeple isn’t just a local game store—it’s a cornerstone of the gaming community. With an incredible staff, thoughtful ownership, and a vibrant player base, it's a model for what a game store should be. Whether you're looking to compete, learn, or simply connect with other players, this is the place to be.

Amazing local game store. Inclusive, fun, and accommodating. Great range of products in the shop in front, and a great community of gamers in the room in back. The mullet of LGSes, you might say. A fantastic place to buy supplies, play TCGs or TTRPGs, or shop for gifts for gamers you love.

My first time here, and I felt completely out of place. I was ignored the entire time, despite the store not being particularly busy. When I first walked in, there were a few people at the front near the glass cases and register, so I decided to browse the board games in the back while waiting for the foot traffic to settle. (By the way, great selection!) Once some people left, I returned to the front to check out the TCG cards. I stood there, clearly looking at the display, yet not a single acknowledgment—no “Hey, let me know if you need anything,” not even eye contact. I totally understand if employees are occupied or need a moment before assisting a customer, but usually, there’s at least some form of communication.
I’m not sure if I was ignored because I was a female customer alone or if this is just standard practice, but it was definitely noticeable that others were greeted and helped—just not me. Maybe there’s a secret password I didn’t know? Either way, not a great first impression for someone new to the community.

I gave 2 stars because I was genuinely excited to check this place out, and they do have an awesome selection. Unfortunately, I left empty handed and feeling like my presence was an inconvenience. Not exactly the welcoming experience I was hoping for.

Market price for this product on release day? $10. How much was Meeple selling for? $35, over THREE TIMES retail price. This local game store is worse than regular scalpers because they are out here normalizing insane prices. The surprise box that released today is supposed to be a $20 product, and they are selling it for $65. I understand a small upcharge, like $5-$10 per item, but this is out of hand. The manager at this store should feel ashamed for taking advantage of their customers. The only reason why I bought one tin is so I could get one for my sibling, who hasn't been able to get a single prismatic evolutions product since release. This is absolutely disgusting behavior, and I hope other people don't give in and pay such obnoxious prices. I will never be bringing my business here again.

The Mighty Meeple is far and away the best game store in the Charlotte Metro area, if not the entire state of North Carolina. It is my immediate recommendation to anyone looking for a space to engage with board games, trading card games, miniatures games, TTRPGs, and more.

The store has an excellent selection of product at fair prices, including a generous rewards points system. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable of the products, and most employees are passionate enough about the products that they’ll be the same people you see playing in the store. Dave, one of the owners, is extraordinarily friendly and present in the store, and goes above and beyond to accommodate different groups and individuals to ensure they have a welcoming, safe, and most of all fun experience.

The Mighty Meeple offers a community play space with a wide selection of games to demo at no cost. The play area is large compared to other stores, and it is always tidy and clean. They have sections dedicated to miniatures games as well so that there is no competing for play space. Their concession area is well-stocked with various snacks, baked goods, and beverages. If you drink, they also have a nice selection of beer and ciders on draught, as well as a selection of wine.

The store actively supports and fosters communities. They have been immensely supportive of our efforts to kickstart a Pauper Magic: the Gathering night, providing free prize support and sectioning off an area of the play space to reserve for our use. This is the case for many different games, not just Magic. Mighty Meeple has an event of some kind going on almost every day, so that those interested in meeting up with like-minded individuals have a space to do so. They put in the effort to maintain an impressive scheduling board in their play space so that you can be comfortable in knowing when different events of interest are happening. The Mighty Meeple is an important “third place” for many of its patrons and does a great job maintaining that role. I have met many of my close friends through events that Meeple has offered.

The Mighty Meeple is the gold standard for game stores, and I encourage you to check it out.
